item.title: SOLID - Liskov Substitution Principle
item.description: The Liskov Substitution Principle defines that objects of a derived class should be substitutable for objects of the base class without affecting the correctness of the program. In simpler terms, any instance of a base class should be replaceable with an instance of a derived class without altering the desired properties of the program.
